title: Ticket #5431: shared port should fail when source and destination are the same
description:
In order to avoid a deadlock on windows when the collector tries to update it ad to itself, the shared port daemon should quickly refuse to allow a daemon to open a socket to itself using the shared port as intermediary.

This will turn a hang and failure into a simple failure.
remarks:
2015-Dec-04 13:42:53 by tlmiller:
I have patch that should work if a daemon specifically requests itself, but that doesn't seem to actually happen. Instead, the collector tries to connect to itself by connecting without specifying a shared port at all; when it does so, since it doesn't (and can't) send its own ID along, the shared port daemon has no way to tell what's going on.

2015-Dec-10 17:48:34 by tlmiller:
Code Review

The code looks good, but I'm not sure about the cost of checking every forwarding request. I hate to add knobs, but maybe this a good place to add one with a comment in the param table that it's a potential scalability thing? I don't know. I'm also always leery of omitting safety.
